releases.notes: No real changes, just demo for release tool.

name: Wolfenstein 3D Pain Face
description:
Show your level of pain with a Wolfenstein 3D inspired pain face.

 * Use W'bal, heart rate or power output for the pain source.
 * State of the art graphics (for 1992)
 * May induce feelings of nostalgia.
 * Mein Leben!!!

releases.notes:
version 1.64 is mostly improvements (I hope) to the segment results multilap window
- when crossing the finish line of an event that also finishes at a segment, the segment results window will keep showing results from the event rather than switching out to the default world one
- in events that are longer than an hour, segment results should work properly now.  Prior to this, after around an hour the segment results start aging out of the results from Zwift which messed up counting how many times racers had been through a segment.  Results are now stored locally so they should persist and work properly.  I didn't give this a lot of testing as the opportunity to watch events that go longer than an hour is limited and when I had to fix something, I often had to wait for another event (and then wait for the hour to go by).
- the points leaderboard window no longer relies on having an active elevation profile window
- fix for the points leaderboard when the number of racers matches the number of point values. ie. 10 racers and point scores of 10..1 would assign 0 to the 10th rider.
- fixes for custom POI creation and improperly displaying powerups when a custom POI was next on the route

name: Zenmaster
description:
Arend's Mod Collection

* Fully customizable route elevation profiles
* See the active powerups in your group when the HUD is off
* Segment leaderboards
* Preview route and segment profiles
* Pace partner routes and current locations
* Lap data windows for workouts
* Leaderboards for points races

name: Costco Guys BOOM
